Claim: “Go to 2020census.gov and fill out this census form so you can get your stimulus check.”
Explaination: Your response to the U.S. Census won't affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Go to 2020census.gov and fill out this census form so you can get your stimulus check.”

Explanation:Your response to the U.S. Census won't affect whether you get a federal stimulus check.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/23/facebook-posts/no-your-census-response-wont-affect-whether-you-ge/

Claim: Prince Charles is infected with coronavirus after meeting Indian singer Kanika Kapoor.
Explaination: Viral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Prince Charles is infected with coronavirus after meeting Indian singer Kanika Kapoor.

Explanation:Viral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/old-pictures-kanika-kapoor-prince-charles-viral-coronavirus-royal-1659755-2020-03-26

Claim: A Chinese SWAT Team takes down a coronavirus suspect
Explaination: A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocities on its patients.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Chinese SWAT Team takes down a coronavirus suspect

Explanation:A mock drill video was shared as China committing atrocities on its patients.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/coronavirus-mock-drill-by-chinese-police-viral-as-real-6997?infinitescroll=1

Claim: The Department of Health (DOH) and the Bureau of Immigration (BI) “issued a lookout bulletin” for the “arrest and detention” of a Chinese man who “escaped the quarantine area” of the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA).
Explaination: The BI clarified in a statement that the story of the foreigner's "escape" from NAIA's quarantine area is a hoax. Further, the DOH did not issue any advisory or bulletin about a foreigner who escaped the NAIA quarantine area.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Department of Health (DOH) and the Bureau of Immigration (BI) “issued a lookout bulletin” for the “arrest and detention” of a Chinese man who “escaped the quarantine area” of the Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA).

Explanation:The BI clarified in a statement that the story of the foreigner's "escape" from NAIA's quarantine area is a hoax. Further, the DOH did not issue any advisory or bulletin about a foreigner who escaped the NAIA quarantine area.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/253996-doh-bureau-immigration-bulletin-chinese-man-escaped-coronavirus-quarantine

Claim: Boiled garlic water can protect from COVID-19.
Explaination: Health experts refute false claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Boiled garlic water can protect from COVID-19.

Explanation:Health experts refute false claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.

http://u.afp.com/GarlicWater

Claim: A video shows COVID-19 patients in China.
Explaination: It's a school initiation in South Africa.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows COVID-19 patients in China.

Explanation:It's a school initiation in South Africa.

https://factcheck.afp.com/viral-video-shows-high-school-initiation-south-africa

Claim: Coronavirus has a pH level of 5.5 to 8.5 and can be prevented and cured by eating alkaline foods.
Explaination: There is no evidence that the new coronavirus which causes COVID-19 has a unique pH level. And the study referred to in the claim had nothing to do with this particular virus - it was published in 1991, long before the emergence of the new virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus has a pH level of 5.5 to 8.5 and can be prevented and cured by eating alkaline foods.

Explanation:There is no evidence that the new coronavirus which causes COVID-19 has a unique pH level. And the study referred to in the claim had nothing to do with this particular virus - it was published in 1991, long before the emergence of the new virus.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/coronavirus-doesnt-have-own-ph-level-alkaline-food-wont-beat-it/

Claim: 10,000 people have died in Wuhan, China.
Explaination: As of early Jan. 27, the estimated death toll is 81 — all of them in China.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 10,000 people have died in Wuhan, China.

Explanation:As of early Jan. 27, the estimated death toll is 81 — all of them in China.

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/01/misinformation-on-coronavirus-death-toll/

Claim: A claim has circulated on social media that a “new virus” named hantavirus has emerged in China in March 2020. The posts were viewed hundreds of thousands of times as the world battled the spread of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.
Explaination: The claim is false; scientists say hantavirus is not a new virus and was first detected during the Korean War in the 1950s; the US-based Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says the virus has almost exclusively been found to pass from rodents to humans, rather than from person to person.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim has circulated on social media that a “new virus” named hantavirus has emerged in China in March 2020. The posts were viewed hundreds of thousands of times as the world battled the spread of the novel coronavirus, which causes the disease COVID-19.

Explanation:The claim is false; scientists say hantavirus is not a new virus and was first detected during the Korean War in the 1950s; the US-based Centre for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) says the virus has almost exclusively been found to pass from rodents to humans, rather than from person to person.

https://factcheck.afp.com/myth-circulates-online-new-hantavirus-disease-has-emerged-china

Claim: Lysol products can kill the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel (or new) coronavirus strain.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Lysol products can kill the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel (or new) coronavirus strain.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471770-fact-check-lysol-products-can-kill-older-strains-of-coronavirus-but-tests-have-not-scientifically-proven-they-kill-novel-coronavirus.html

Claim: This is a self-check test for coronavirus.
Explaination: No, holding your breath for 10 seconds isn't a coronavirus ‘Self-check test. Keeping your throat moist and drinking water every 15 minutes cannot kill coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: This is a self-check test for coronavirus.

Explanation:No, holding your breath for 10 seconds isn't a coronavirus ‘Self-check test. Keeping your throat moist and drinking water every 15 minutes cannot kill coronavirus.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-holding-your-breath-for-10-seconds-isnt-a-coronavirus-self-check-test/

Claim: Image of a herd of deer sitting on a street interpreted as different locations in Sri Lanka and India.
Explaination: Original image of the herd of deer on streets belong to an old incident in Nara, Japan.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Image of a herd of deer sitting on a street interpreted as different locations in Sri Lanka and India.

Explanation:Original image of the herd of deer on streets belong to an old incident in Nara, Japan.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/02/fact-check-old-image-from-japan-shown-as-recent-flock-of-deer/

Claim: Paraguayans should not go out “even to buy bread” because the incubation period is up and positive cases of coronavirus will increase.
Explaination: A WhatsApp message says that doctors warned people to not got out at all because the incubation period of coronavirus in Paraguay was at bay. The message was also shared in Spain and had no grounds to be true.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Paraguayans should not go out “even to buy bread” because the incubation period is up and positive cases of coronavirus will increase.

Explanation:A WhatsApp message says that doctors warned people to not got out at all because the incubation period of coronavirus in Paraguay was at bay. The message was also shared in Spain and had no grounds to be true.

https://elsurti.com/coronavirus-falso-salir-pan/

Claim: A line of coffins suggesting they are from Italy currently.
Explaination: Old image of 2013 of migrants dying in a shipwreck shared as recent.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A line of coffins suggesting they are from Italy currently.

Explanation:Old image of 2013 of migrants dying in a shipwreck shared as recent.

https://www.boomlive.in/coronavirus-outbreak/dated-photo-showing-rows-of-coffins-shared-as-coronavirus-hit-italy-7306

Claim: “Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!… BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always”
Explaination: The viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: “Ministry of Health ITALY released a small video, HOW the virus spreads!!!… BEST VIDEO. Please see ..how innocently it spread. SOAP is the remedy CLEAN/ WASH ur Hands always”

Explanation:The viral video is not released by the health ministry of Italy in the wake of coronavirus but it is long-existing on YouTube, we reached the conclusion that the viral claim is ‘Misleading’.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15267122

Claim: World Economic Forum is a “fascist cabal” manipulating coronavirus.
Explaination: This is a conspiracy theory.
Label: False
html:
Claim: World Economic Forum is a “fascist cabal” manipulating coronavirus.

Explanation:This is a conspiracy theory.

Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.
Explaination: The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.
Label: False
html:
Claim: American citizens have placed a nude statue of President Donald Trump in New York City because he failed to handle the coronavirus situation in USA.

Explanation:The video is almost 4 years old and is unrelated to the current Novel coronavirus situation.

Claim: UNICEF ​​advises not to eat ice cream because it reinforces infection with the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Unicef has already denied this information in public, releasing an official statement explaining that this statement is a lie.
Label: False
html:
Claim: UNICEF ​​advises not to eat ice cream because it reinforces infection with the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Unicef has already denied this information in public, releasing an official statement explaining that this statement is a lie.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-unicef-aconselha-a-nao-comer-gelados-por-causa-do-coronavirus/

Claim: US Homeland Security mobilizing National Guard to combat coronavirus.
Explaination: National Guard refuted claims.
Label: False
html:
Claim: US Homeland Security mobilizing National Guard to combat coronavirus.

Explanation:National Guard refuted claims.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472030-fact-check-homeland-security-is-not-preparing-to-mobilize-the-national-guard-to-combat-coronavirus.html

Claim: The “proper” way to wear a surgical mask is blue side out if you are sick and white side out if you do not want to be infected by the virus.
Explaination: The World Health Organization, the Philippine Red Cross, the country's Department of Health, San Francisco’s Department of Public Health: Disease Prevention and Control, and the Hong Kong government are all one in saying there is only one way to wear surgical masks: have the blue color on the outside and the white on the inside.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The “proper” way to wear a surgical mask is blue side out if you are sick and white side out if you do not want to be infected by the virus.

Explanation:The World Health Organization, the Philippine Red Cross, the country's Department of Health, San Francisco’s Department of Public Health: Disease Prevention and Control, and the Hong Kong government are all one in saying there is only one way to wear surgical masks: have the blue color on the outside and the white on the inside.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-manila-vice-mayor-lacuna-demos-wrong-w

Claim: Indian Government and the WHO advised people not to purchase colors from China for Holi.
Explaination: No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian Government and the WHO advised people not to purchase colors from China for Holi.

Explanation:No such advisory was shared by the government or the Ministry.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/fake-advisory-warns-against-buying-holi-colours-from-coronavirus-hit-china-7004

Claim: Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India.
Explaination: There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh. And the man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken. The viral post is fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India.

Explanation:There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh. And the man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken. The viral post is fake.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-man-critical-with-novel-coronavirus-in-barhalganj-is-fake-till-date-no-positive-case-reported-in-gorakhpur/

Claim: Social media posts shared thousands of times advocate 10 methods to prevent a novel coronavirus infection, citing recommendations allegedly stemming from autopsies on COVID-19 victims, including in China, where the virus first emerged.
Explaination: The advice is misleading; experts say the list includes half-truths and outright falsehoods.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Social media posts shared thousands of times advocate 10 methods to prevent a novel coronavirus infection, citing recommendations allegedly stemming from autopsies on COVID-19 victims, including in China, where the virus first emerged.

Explanation:The advice is misleading; experts say the list includes half-truths and outright falsehoods.

https://factcheck.afp.com/these-10-tips-preventing-covid-19-contain-false-information

Claim: Javier Ortega Smith, from VOX, has said that he prefers to be infected by the new coronavirus than to “have homosexualism”.
Explaination: This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Javier Ortega Smith, from VOX, has said that he prefers to be infected by the new coronavirus than to “have homosexualism”.

Explanation:This is false; provincial health officials and the mall administrator told AFP that no cases are connected to the mall to date.

https://factcheck.afp.com/whatsapp-message-falsely-links-bc-mall-covid-19-outbreak
ann22_remarks: The claim does not relate to explanation
